key_title: Key to the species of Dodonaea

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Sapindaceae

source.author: Duretto, M.F.
source.title: Sapindaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Duretto, M.F. (1999). Sapindaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves pinnate
Leaves simple
Leaflets linear to linear-lanceolate, apex acute to obtuse; branchlets glabrous
Leaflets narrow-obovate to angular-obovate, apex toothed or lobed; branchlets densely covered with short, curved hairs
Leaves not viscid, usually simple but sometimes imparipinnate; fruit shorter than 7 mm long, wings 6–10 mm wide; Grampians
Leaves viscid, paripinnate; fruit longer than 8 mm, wings 2–7 mm wide; far north-west
Capsule not winged, or with wing to only 1 mm wide
Capsule with wings wider than 2 mm and extending from capsule base to apex
Leaves obovate, angular-obovate, oblanceolate, or oblong, wider than 3 mm, flat to revolute; sepals caducous, shorter than stamens; aril absent
Leaves linear, less than 3 mm wide, channelled below, convex above, strongly revolute; sepals persistent, c. as long as stamens; seed with white aril
Leaves not viscid, margin entire; branchlets terete to slightly angular
Leaves viscid, usually with 1–4 irregular teeth on distal half; branchlets angular or flattened
Leaves viscid
Leaves not viscid
Leaves sessile, lamina extending as a rib or small wing down stem; flowers in axillary cymes; East Gippsland
Leaves sessile or petiolate, lamina not extending as a rib or small wing down stem; flowers in terminal panicles; widespread
Leaves petiolate, pinnate leaves never present; inflorescence terminal or axillary; stamens longer than sepals; East Gippsland and north-east Victoria
Leaves sessile, petiolate pinnate leaves sometimes present; inflorescence axillary; stamens c. as long as sepals; Grampians
Inflorescence an axillary cyme; capsule 4-winged, wings 6–8.5 mm wide; leaves usually white-spotted below
Inflorescence a terminal panicle; capsule 3-winged, wings 2–5 mm wide; leaves never white-spotted below
